tool_description: Manages Certificate Revocation List entries, adding revoked certificates with reason codes and timestamps for distribution through CRL publication points.

certificate_serial.description: Serial number of certificate to revoke

revocation_reason.description: Revocation reason: unspecified, keyCompromise, caCompromise, affiliationChanged, superseded, cessationOfOperation, certificateHold, removeFromCRL

revocation_date.description: Date of revocation (defaults to current time)

invalidity_date.description: Date when certificate became invalid (for backdated revocations)

error_messages: Certificate not found: Serial number does not correspond to any issued certificate.
Invalid revocation reason: Use a valid RFC 5280 revocation reason code.
Certificate already revoked: Certificate is already present in the CRL.
Invalid date format: Dates must be in valid ISO 8601 format.
Invalidity date after revocation: Invalidity date cannot be later than revocation date.
Certificate expired: Cannot revoke a certificate that has already expired.
usage: Provide certificate_serial and revocation_reason. Optionally specify custom revocation_date and invalidity_date. Tool adds the certificate to the CRL with proper reason codes.

crl_entry_added.description: Whether the CRL entry was successfully added

serial_number.description: Serial number of the revoked certificate

next_crl_update.description: Timestamp when next CRL will be published
